items.title: Heatwave stretches from Kimberley to Sydney as hot summer arrives

items.title: What is shotcrete, the material that caused Sydney's M4 tunnel closure?

items.title: Pentagon watchdog releases report on Pete Hegseth's use of Signal app

items.title: Lawyers to face regulators after AI was used to prepare legal document
items.summary: Three lawyers will face Australian legal regulators, with one ordered to pay $10,000 in costs, after submitting a legal document prepared with artificial intelligence and found to contain "inaccurate and misleading references".

items.title: Israel-aligned anti-Hamas Gaza militia leader Yasser Abu Shabab killed
items.summary: Gaza militia leader Yasser Abu Shabab, whose anti-Hamas group had been supported by Israel, has been killed after an attack in southern Gaza.

items.title: Australia's PALM workers are leaving their employers, becoming 'extremely vulnerable' in visa limbo
items.summary: Pacific Islanders have been leaving Australia's guest worker scheme, a decision that breaches their visa conditions and leaves them "extremely vulnerable".

items.title: Industrial relations are risky business for the Liberals after WorkChoices
items.summary: The Liberals argue Labor's industrial relations concessions to the unions are a "handbrake on productivity" but this area has been tricky for the Coalition since John Howard's disastrous overreach.

items.title: Teen becomes first nationally accredited netball umpire in a wheelchair
items.summary: Brodie Taylor has changed the game of netball by overturning disability preconceptions to become the first person in a wheelchair to attain national netball umpiring accreditation.

items.title: Is Tasmanian AFL team a holy grail or poisoned chalice? Time will tell
items.summary: When it comes to the Macquarie Point stadium in Tasmania, there is clearly something deeper at play than seats, concrete and a roof. You simply couldn't vote for it otherwise, writes Chris Rowbottom.

items.title: Corowa residents caught off guard by 'early' fire a sign of 'apathy', authorities say
items.summary: A fast moving grass fire almost burned through the southern NSW town of Corowa last week. Despite the extreme fire danger rating, residents say they weren't prepared for such an intense fire so early in the season.

items.title: Victorian prisoners held in police stations for weeks, lawyer says
items.summary: A Victorian lawyer says a "crisis" is unfolding in the state's jails, with remand centres so crowded prisoners are instead being kept in police holding cells for up to a month.

items.title: Today in History, December 5: How Prohibition was brought down by gangsters, bootleggers and violence

items.title: The best new TV shows of 2025, from The Golden Bachelor to The Studio

items.title: Community housing provider HousingFirst defends dual rent rises on newly acquired properties
items.summary: Elderly residents in Melbourne's south-east say they are in financial distress after two rent increases, which a community housing organisation says are a necessary move to a standard rent-setting model.

items.summary: A UK public inquiry has concluded that Russian President Vladimir Putin "must have" ordered the Novichok nerve agent attack on Russian double agent Sergei Skripal in 2018.

items.title: Search for missing flight MH370 to resume this month, Malaysia says
items.summary: The search for missing Malaysia Airlines Flight MH370 will resume at the end of December, more than a decade after the Beijing-bound flight disappeared.

items.title: Parents left with PTSD after son's death question post-operative care for people with disabilities
items.summary: The parents of a young man with a neuromuscular disease who died seven days after spinal surgery say they have serious concerns about the post-operative care he was provided at Royal Perth Hospital.

items.title: Michael and Susan Dell donate nearly $10 billion to 'Trump accounts' for children
items.summary: Tech billionaires Michael and Susan Dell have pledged $US6.25 billion ($9.5 billion) to new investment accounts for children, known as "Trump accounts". Here's how the donation will work.

items.title: Government considers offloading retiring Tiger helicopters to Ukraine
items.summary: As the United States attempts to broker a peace deal at the Kremlin in Moscow, it is expected a significant funding boost from Canberra to aid Ukraine's war efforts is imminent.

items.title: Bruce Lehrmann loses appeal against failed rape defamation case as lawyer hints at High Court challenge
items.summary: Bruce Lehrmann has lost his appeal against a Federal Court ruling that found on the balance of probabilities he raped his then-colleague Brittany Higgins in 2019.

items.title: What happened to Lisa Lynn? The untold story of Greg Lynn's first marriage and his wife's sudden death
items.summary: Long before Greg Lynn was convicted of murder in Victoria's High Country, his estranged wife died suddenly at home in Mount Macedon. Now, some of those closest to Lisa Lynn are pushing for the coroner to re-examine her death.

items.title: What led Donald Trump to pardon a foreign leader convicted of helping to flood the US with drugs
items.summary: Donald Trump says his country is at war with "narco-terrorists". But he is releasing the former president of Honduras, who was jailed in the US for overseeing one of the world's worst drug conspiracies.

items.title: Pat Cummins eyeing early return from injury in Gabba Test with Josh Inglis poised for Ashes debut
items.summary: Australian skipper Pat Cummins is pushing for an early return from injury in the second Test in Brisbane while Josh Inglis will be making his Ashes debut.

items.summary: The second Ashes Test is upon us and we have fingers crossed it will last more than two days. Here's everything you need to know.

items.title: Hugh Jackman and Kate Hudson surprise patrons with impromptu performance at Aussie pub in NYC
items.summary: Hugh Jackman sung the crowd-pleaser Sweet Caroline and even climbed onto the top of the bar counter for the performance.

items.title: Demersal fishing ban announced for commercial, recreational fishers in Perth and WA amid scarce fish stocks
items.summary: Strict bans limiting commercial and recreational fishing in Perth and WA are announced in an effort to save some under-threat fish species from the brink of collapse.

items.title: Council says warnings ignored about tree removal in Central West Orana REZ
items.summary: The NSW government is being accused of wilfully ignoring warnings about the destruction of hundreds of native trees as part of a renewables project.

items.title: Crystal Fabergé egg shatters record, fetching $46m at auction
items.summary: The Winter Egg is made from finely carved rock crystal, covered in a delicate snowflake motif wrought in platinum with 4,500 tiny diamonds.

items.title: Hopes remain for return of eagles to relocated nest at Bundaberg Hospital site
items.summary: A wedge-tailed eagle's nest was moved in an operation costing about $100,000 involving a 60-tonne crane, a specialist arborist and a carefully engineered basket.

items.title: Data centre spending spree and housing boom drive economic growth
items.summary: Australia's economy grew by 0.4 per cent in the September quarter, driven by data centre spending spree and housing boom

items.title: Humanitarian migrants in US fear being deported into danger following shooting
items.summary: The Trump administration's escalating restrictions on humanitarian migration are leaving some of the United States's most vulnerable diaspora communities terrified for their futures.

items.title: Donald Trump says he is terminating any pardons, commutations signed by Biden using autopen
items.summary: US President Donald Trump says he is terminating all documents, including pardons, signed by his predecessor Joe Biden using an autopen signature.

items.title: Report shows violent attacks and street abuse 'the norm' for Australian Jews, peak body says
items.summary: Executive Council of Australian Jewry Alex Ryvchin said the data showed antisemitism remained at "deeply troubling levels".

items.title: Sabrina Carpenter slams White House for using her music in ICE video
items.summary: Two-time Grammy winner Sabrina Carpenter slams the White House for using her song in a social media post about ICE raids, telling the Trump administration to never involve her in its "inhumane agenda".

items.title: Family unable to move from government housing next to drug den
items.summary: A single mother-of-two no longer feels safe in her government-provided housing after her child found a used needle in their backyard.

items.title: More than 50 couples marry in mass Gaza wedding after two years of Israeli attacks
items.summary: Thousands of Palestinians turn out in Gaza's Khan Younis to celebrate the wedding of 54 couples who had been unable to tie the knot during Israel's bombardment of the strip.

items.title: WA Police Arson Squad pinpoint ignition point of Geraldton bushfire that destroyed home
items.summary: Police offer up a $25,000 reward as they try to determine the cause of a blaze that tore through 160 hectares of land, left two homes uninhabitable and completely destroyed another in Geraldton.

items.title: Hobart's Macquarie Point stadium project set to pass Tasmanian parliament

items.title: Gold Coast council's Springbrook cableway edges forward but with slashed funding
items.summary: The Gold Coast's long-running cableway proposal has inched forward after councillors redirected funds from First Nations consultation to environmental studies.

items.summary: Hayley masks their struggles so well in dance class that teachers can't tell. But when they get home, they collapse — sometimes missing days of school.

items.summary: Filmmaking siblings Tristan and Timothy Kenyon's documentary Changing Track explores how competing in the Paralympics changes lives.

items.title: Indonesian diaspora divided over new Global Citizenship visa scheme as new details emerge
items.summary: Indonesia's new visa scheme is being touted as a solution to dual citizenship. But some in the Indonesian community say the visa has "no real benefit" and amounts to a government revenue grab.

items.summary: More than 1,300 people are dead and 1.2 million displaced following devastating flooding and landslides in South-East Asia.

items.summary: Backpackers and PALM workers in Victoria and Queensland are looking for new jobs following the shock shutdown of Dicky Bill Australia.

items.summary: The independent body in charge of overseeing NSW Police misconduct allegations will today probe the response to Lindy Lucena's fatal bashing in 2023.

items.summary: Australia's longest-running radio show is celebrating 80 years on air, and while so much has changed in farming and broadcasting, the core of The Country Hour remains the same.

items.title: Israel wants buffer zone between occupied Golan Heights and Damascus in peace deal with Syria
items.summary: Benjamin Netanyahu demands Syria establish a "demilitarised zone" between the border with the Israeli-annexed Golan Heights and capital Damascus, as part of any possible peace deal with the new Syrian government.

items.title: Proton therapy cancer unit debacle leads to $US32 million lawsuit

items.title: Environment Protection Authority to monitor Ballarat Gold Mine amid air pollution concerns
items.summary: Ballarat Gold Mine has exceeded national standards for potentially dangerous air pollutants.

items.title: Small businesses losing thousands to fraudulent online chargeback claims
items.summary: Frustrated retailers grappling with online shoplifters are calling for better protections from banks, payment providers and regulators.

items.title: Today in history, December 3: Bhopal gas leak kills thousands in world's worst industrial accident
items.summary: It started with a cloud of gas in the dead of night, silently submerging the city in a toxic soup. By morning on December 3, 1984, an Indian city awoke to a nightmare.

items.title: Imran Khan is alive but suffering psychological strain and isolation in prison, his sister says
items.summary: The imprisoned former Pakistani prime minister is visited by one of his sisters for the first time in weeks, providing an update on his health after rumours swirled about his wellbeing.

items.title: Japan and China coast guards offer conflicting accounts of incident near disputed islands
items.summary: Tokyo and Beijing have given different accounts of the clash as relations between the two countries continue to sour following comments made by Japan's prime minister about Taiwan.

items.title: End to war in Ukraine 'no closer' after US-Russia talks
items.summary: The Kremlin says a resolution to the war in Ukraine is "no closer" after a meeting between Russian President Vladimir Putin and two of Donald Trump's most powerful envoys.

items.title: Lemon8 and Yope put on notice as social media age ban targets
items.summary: Social media platforms Lemon8 and Yope are put on notice about age limit laws as both apps surge in popularity ahead of a ban for under 16s.

items.title: WA Electoral Commissioner Robert Kennedy resigns months after problem-plagued state election
items.summary: Robert Kennedy tends his resignation as WA electoral commissioner, nine months after a state election that was plagued by issues including long wait-times to vote, and polling booths running out of ballot papers.

items.title: Government reveals national AI plan to 'serve' Australians
items.summary: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

items.title: ACT legislates commitment for public servants to uphold 'Closing the Gap principle' in Australian first

items.title: Six prisoners remain in NT watch houses after report exposes 'inhumane' conditions
items.summary: Days after acting Northern Territory Ombudsman Bronwyn Haack raised the alarm about "inhumane" conditions in overcrowded police cells, the government says just six inmates remain.

items.title: Employees ponder bleak Christmas after sudden collapse of caravan manufacturer Zone RV
items.summary: Questions are being asked about why Zone RV fell into administration, leaving hundreds of workers unemployed and customers in limbo.

items.title: Singapore-based firm scraps Darwin hotel project after sacred site fight
items.summary: A $100 million luxury hotel planned for the Darwin Waterfront has fallen through, after concerns were raised by Larrakia traditional owners over its interference with a sacred site.

items.title: Three deaths related to asbestos exposure at former ABC site
items.summary: Staff at the former ABC studios in Elsternwick were exposed to asbestos over an extended period.

items.title: Review into incident at Tasmania's Ashley Youth Detention Centre of makeshift spit hood on detainee's head tabled in parliament
items.summary: An incident at a Tasmanian youth detention centre where a detainee had an improvised spit hood put over his head while being transported by a contracted security company, has been criticised for being "entirely incompatible" with human rights.

items.title: Ravensthorpe deputy shire president Mark Mudie killed in West River fire
items.summary: A farmer who died trying to stop a "treacherous" fire from destroying his family's property in WA's south is identified as the local town's deputy shire president.

items.summary: The Northern Territory government has signed a deal to build a new "open-security" prison work camp at Charles Darwin University's Katherine campus, with the facility expected to house at least 130 prisoners.

items.summary: A Queensland man charged with assisting the suicides of three people has successfully applied for bail.

items.summary: Park Waves festival, set for February 2026, has been cancelled amid economic challenges, joining a growing list of scrapped Australian music events.

items.title: Optus reveals nearly half a million phones may be unable to dial Triple Zero
items.summary: The figure has been provided to a Senate estimates hearing, where the media regulator appeared on Tuesday.

items.title: Principal allegedly stabbed by staff member at Keysborough Secondary College in Melbourne

items.title: Rise in threats by sovereign citizens sparks call for Victorian judges to receive security allowance
items.summary: A report tabled in state parliament has recommended judicial officers be paid an allowance to increase their personal security.

items.title: New images show Chinese flotilla with formidable firepower in Philippine Sea
items.summary: Private firm Starboard Maritime Intelligence says it has used satellite technology to track down the People's Liberation Army Navy task group.

items.title: Neighbour called abuse line to report mother accused of daughter's neglect, court hears
items.summary: A former neighbour of a mother standing trial accused of criminally neglecting her daughter tried to report concerns to an abuse line, but her call went unanswered, a court has heard.
